intro: Lesquerella occidentalis var. diversifolia, commonly known as the western lesquerella, is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy, alternate leaves that often have a distinctive greenish or reddish hue. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits containing oily seeds that are rich in erucic acid. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its unique chemical composition, it has been studied for potential industrial and agricultural applications.
